TopicTitle: waiting for the David Bowie memorial cinematics

Articles.Content:
RIP David Bowie. Why do the best artists always die before their time?

Considering how much he liked space and that he made "Ground control to major Tom" and "Starman", i'm betting it's only a matter of time before someone makes a well-deserved memorial cinematic for him. Nassault made one for carl sagan, so why not bowie
I may or may not cover some of his songs, I have yet to decide... I hope Nassault makes something for him. He was a massive icon.
The cover of Space Oddity from Chris Hadfield is already a pretty good one IMO.. but it was already made in 2013

Starman have been used by matt lowne in this video

 

Very nice song for ksp

I was thinking about it all day at work. Matt's is better, but I needed to do one.

 

A farewell to David Bowie. No one did it quite as well as he did. Fly well, mate.

Ashes to Ashes copyright David Bowie, used with noncommercial intent as an homage.

The SSTO is the Diamond Dog, for obvious reasons. It turns out diamond-shaped wings are absolutely horrific in an atmosphere. But it had style, and that counts for something.

Edited January 12, 2016 by Gojira1000
link fix
Given that most early to mid stage missions involving EVA or orbiting seem to end up exactly like major tom by default I always felt it should have been KSPs themesong

I ought to make a music video of Major Tom in KSP...  Does anyone know whether I can use his music without royalties?  I know that I could just use it since other people has with having their videos taken down, but I don't to just steal his music.

On 1/12/2016 at 9:18 PM, MagicFireCaster said:

Starman have been used by matt lowne in this video

 

Very nice song for ksp

I feel like this is already a tribute. love it!
Who is David Bowie?  Never heard of him (ok, I lied, I heard of the name, but do not know of WHO he is or what he is known for...)

18 hours ago, Sampa said:

Who is David Bowie?  Never heard of him (ok, I lied, I heard of the name, but do not know of WHO he is or what he is known for...)

Okay, so, Bowie was basically an icon, he represented a whole group of people, and transcended genres and generations...You ca find lots of information on wikipedia, and I suggest you listen to his music. I doubt I can represent what he did, an what he stood for with my few words, though.
